member.name: PointF.Equals
member.summary: The PointF.Equals method determines whether twoPointF objects are equal. Two points are considered equal if they have the sameX andY data members.
member.param: Reference to aPointF object that is compared to thisPointF object.
member.returns: If thePointF objects are equal, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: PointF.PointF
member.summary: Creates a new PointF object and copies the data from another PointF object.
member.param: Reference to a PointF object whoseX andY data members are copied into theX andY data members of the new PointF object.

member.name: PointF.PointF
member.summary: Creates a PointF object using aSizeF object to specify theX andY data members.
member.param: Reference to aSizeF object whoseWidth data member specifies theX data member of this PointF object, and whoseHeight data member specifies theY data member of this PointF object.

member.name: PointF.PointF
member.summary: Creates a PointF object using two real numbers to specify theX andY data members.
member.param: Real number that specifies the x-coordinate of the PointF object.
Real number that specifies the y-coordinate of the PointF object.

member.name: PointF.PointF
member.summary: Creates a PointF object and initializes theX andY data members to zero. This is the default constructor.
